Process: Check taxonomical status
Methods / Tools: e.g. Web service of Taxonomic Name Resolution Service (TNRS)Normalization of species names against GBIF Backbone in https://www.gbif.org/tools/species-lookup

Process: Does the scientific name have authorship information?
Methods / Tools: bdc::bdc_clean_names [18]

Process: Is the record identified at a proper taxonomic rank?
Methods / Tools: Filter records using field like 'dwc::taxonRank' and check if scientific names correspond to species, genus, varieties, etc. e.g. ‘Fossilbrush::format_check’ [24]

Process: Type of matching exact
Methods / Tools: Match taxon names with the exact same spelling [12] (e.g. Taxonstand based on The Plant List)
bdc::bdc_query_names_taxadb suggest_names = FALSE [18]

Process: Type of matching fuzzy
Methods / Tools:
Match taxon names that differ by some characters [12] using orthographic distanced metrics (e.g. TNRS).
User-specified score value of orthographic distance as threshold of matching.
bdc::bdc_query_names_taxadb suggest_names = TRUE [18]

Process: Taxon. Coverage specific
Methods / Tools: e.g. Plants: taxonStand; WorldFlora; TNRS: taxize/taxizedb. Paleodiversity:  fossilbrush [24] and paleoverse [25]

Process: Taxon. Coverage general
Methods / Tools: e.g. GBIF backbone name parser rgbif; Global Name Resolver web service

Process: Spatial coverage global
Methods / Tools: e.g. Flora Iberica

Process: Spatial coverage global
Methods / Tools: e.g. GBIF backbone name parser; Taxonomic Name Resolution Service; WorldFlora

Process: Checklist Type automatic
Methods / Tools: e.g. Taxonomic Name Resolution Service (TNRS); WorldFlora, GBIF backbone name parser, bdc::bdc_query_names_taxadb [18]

Process: 1. Check and filter based on coordinates precision. Choose and option:
Methods / Tools: Use fields like dwc::coordinatePrecision
Use number of decimal digits of coordinates as a measure of their precision or bdc::bdc_coordinates_precision [18]

Process: 2.Check coordinates value and do not validate records if any of these conditions are true.
Methods / Tools: CoordinateCleaner::cc_equ [17]

Ranges: Latitude > 90/-90 and Longitude > 180/-180
Use bdc::bdc_coordinates_outOfRange [18] or
CoordinateCleaner::cc_val [17]
Use CoordinateCleaner::cc_zero [17]

Process: a. Are coordinates placed in correct habitat (sea / land)?
Methods / Tools: CoordinateCleaner::cc_sea [17]
bdc::bdc_coordinates_country_inconsistent [18]
Point in polygon function over study area shapefile.

Process: b. Are coordinates placed in the country assigned?
Methods / Tools: bdc::bdc_country_from_coordinates and bdc::bdc_country_standardized[18]
CoordinateCleaner::cc_coun [17]
Point in polygon function using countries shapefile from GADM.

Process: c. Check position of records that are not placed in the country assigned.
Methods / Tools: Check country borders (plantR:: checkBorders)
Switch coordinates and validate bcd::bdc_coordinates_transposed
Change sign of latitude and/or longitude and validate [1]
Check if has locality description and retrieve coordinates with gazeteers.

Process: d. Check records placed in prime meridian or equator countries
Methods / Tools: Downscale to regional / state / province / locality administrative unit and check location with point in polygon function.
Change sign of longitude in countries nearby longitude = 0.
Change sign of latitude in countries nearby Equator.
Switch coordinates and validate bcd::bdc_coordinates_transposed

Process: e. Delete or label as potential errors those records whose coordinates are centroids of:
Methods / Tools:
Country or capital
CoordinateCleaner::cc_cap
CoordinateCleaner::cc_cen [17]

Grid
Check collection methods to identify if records were collected following a study sample grid.
Check Artificial Hotspot Occurrence Inventory (AHOI) [22]

Locality or Province
Match and filter records using coordinates from GeoNames or gazeteers.
Check Artificial Hotspot Occurrence Inventory (AHOI) [22]
plantR::validateLoc [21]

Geographic collector places
Check Artificial Hotspot Occurrence Inventory (AHOI) [22]
CoordinateCleaner::cc_inst
CoordinateCleaner::cc_urb [17]
CoordinateCleaner::cc_gbif

Process: a. Retrieve coordinates indicated in other formats from other fields as locality information.
Methods / Tools: biogeo::dmsparse + biogeo::dms2dd [19] to obtain decimal coordinates from degrees.

Process: b.  Use locality information or position description to generate coordinates.
Methods / Tools: Retrieve centroid coordinates from gazeteers using locality name.
Retrieve coordinates manually from GoogleEarth / Google Maps or using biogeo::fromGEarth [19]
bdc::bdc_coordinates_from_locality [18]

Process: Are coordinates placed in the species native range / extent of presence?
Methods / Tools: Point in polygon function using range maps shapefiles.
CoordinateCleaner::cc_iucn
CoordinateCleaner::cc_outl [17]
Bracatus' R package [23]

Process: Does country name match with their native region?
Methods / Tools: String match of fields information (Country or smaller administrative unit) with species checklists (global or regional).

Process: a) Calculate environmental centroids for the species and validate outliers.
Methods / Tools: See methods in Vandepitte et al. 2022 [13]

Process: b. Calculate environmental space for species and check overlaps and delete outliers.
Methods / Tools: See methods in Chapman 2005 [14], Robertson et al. 2016 [19] and Serra-Diaz et al. 2017 [15]

Process: c. Overlap environmental information by geographical position and filter occurrences by threshold.
Methods / Tools: Apply point in polygon function using raster or shapefiles of environmental variables / realms / ecoregions (R/ Python/ QGIS).

Process: Cell
Methods / Tools: a. Cell: biogeo::duplicatesexclude [19]
Create a grid of the study area adapted to cell size needed [11]

Process: Coordinates + Buffer or rounded coordinates
Methods / Tools: a. Consider precision of coordinates with ModestR (query by input number of decimals)
Rounded coordinates decimals and delete based on these values (e.g. 2 decimals) [9] [10]
Proximity distance between records buffer (e.g. 0.25 degrees) [7]

Process: Coordinates
Methods / Tools: a. Use CoordinateCleaner::cc_dupl [17]

Process: Date (DD/MM/YYYY)
Methods / Tools: b. Add date to CoordinateCleaner::cc_dupl [17]

Process: Year
Methods / Tools: b. Add year to CoordinateCleaner::cc_dupl [17]

Process: Recorder Name: TRUE
Methods / Tools: c. Recorder name: OpenRefine offers a way to correct and merge similar 'recordedBy' names.
